paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: Atypical Fanconi anemia with congenital abnormalities and elevated chromosomal breakage

individual_records.phenotype_details: No history of malignancy or bone marrow failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Neither sibling displayed the typical clinical findings of the FA-D1 complementation group, with no history of malignancy or bone marrow failure at the ages of 20 and 23.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No history of malignancy or bone marrow failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Neither sibling displayed the typical clinical findings of the FA-D1 complementation group, with no history of malignancy or bone marrow failure at the ages of 20 and 23.

functional_data.summary: The c.2330dupA variant results in a frameshift and premature truncation of BRCA2, leading to loss of replication fork protection.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is present in both siblings, suggesting it segregates with the atypical phenotype.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional assays and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The siblings have a family history of breast cancer diagnosed later in life.
key_quotes: Biallelic BRCA2/FANCD1 variants (c.2330dupA and c.8524C>T) were identified by whole-exome sequencing.
There is no reported family history of FA, but there are cases of breast cancer that were diagnosed later in life.

patients.phenotype: Atypical Fanconi anemia with congenital abnormalities and elevated chromosomal breakage

individual_records.phenotype_details: No history of malignancy or bone marrow failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Neither sibling displayed the typical clinical findings of the FA-D1 complementation group, with no history of malignancy or bone marrow failure at the ages of 20 and 23.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No history of malignancy or bone marrow failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Neither sibling displayed the typical clinical findings of the FA-D1 complementation group, with no history of malignancy or bone marrow failure at the ages of 20 and 23.

functional_data.summary: The c.8524C>T variant results in a missense change in the highly conserved DNA-binding domain of BRCA2.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is present in both siblings, suggesting it segregates with the atypical phenotype.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional assays and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The siblings have a family history of breast cancer diagnosed later in life.
key_quotes: Biallelic BRCA2/FANCD1 variants (c.2330dupA and c.8524C>T) were identified by whole-exome sequencing.
There is no reported family history of FA, but there are cases of breast cancer that were diagnosed later in life.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Homozygous for the c.8488-1G>A variant, born with a thumb malformation, no history of bone marrow failure or malignancy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: This individual was 30 yr of age at last follow up, was born with a thumb malformation, but had no history of bone marrow failure or malignancy.

functional_data.summary: The c.8488-1G>A variant alters the splice acceptor site of exon 20, leading to a deletion of amino acids.

variants.segregation_data: The individual is homozygous for the variant, indicating it segregates with the atypical phenotype.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional assays and individual case report.
variants.additional_notes: The individual has a history of congenital abnormalities.
key_quotes: This individual was homozygous for the c.8488-1G>A variant (alias 'IVS19-1G>A') that alters the splice acceptor site of exon 20.
This individual was 30 yr of age at last follow up, was born with a thumb malformation, but had no history of bone marrow failure or malignancy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
